text: UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 From sampler tray at Ugly Fish. Looks like water. Smells like sake. Taste is semi-dry, rice, alcohol, umami. Ok.
Bottle. Pours clear and still. Melony and slightly boozy. Relatively clean with some slight sweetness in the finish. Decent.
Nice experience. In the aroma I get white wine and slight citrus. Taste has very long length. Palate is full bodied.

Pours a clear water .. smell is of slight vanilla, rice, and slight alcohol with a melon rind 10 feet away .. . clean stuff for the most part .. . probably just above the average mark for junmais .

.. . .governor elect, get it right moron!

Crystal clear and headless like vodka, aroma is very sweety lychee tropical smell, flavor is very crisp and refreshing, like a fruity water with a slight alcoholic tingle. No rice taste, dry palate afterwards.

Bottle: Pours clear with no legs. The nose is light and ricey with some dry koji notes and some faint melon. The flavor has a mild impact with light acidity and moderate alcohol. Fairly dry and one-dimensional. Light finish. Boring.
very clear, slightly yellow, a popcorn/butter flavor, grains, some diaper, very easy drinking, little to no alcohol despite being 14%
Pours a pale yellowish green color that is very clear. Nose is grainy and fruity and dry. Taste is ultra smooth and has a nice medium boozy finish. Not bad, very pure.
Bottle enjoyed in West Village, Manhattan.  Nicer than expected - a bit buttery.  About as good as can be expected for a mere junmai sake.

Bottle from Mitsuwa. This is a crystal clear sake. Strong grainy aroma with a bit of alcohol. Some dark fruit qualities. Very smooth. No harshness at all. Slight sweetness in the finish. Very mild and easy to drink.
